unnormalised: So, I was watching this episode of "Man vs Wild" (again!) and it got me thinking a lot about wildlife conservation, especially here in India. We have such amazing biodiversity, from the tigers of Ranthambore to the elephants of Kerala. It’s incredible!
normalised: So, I was watching this episode of "Man versus Wild" (again!) and it got me thinking a lot about wildlife conservation, especially here in India. We have such amazing biodiversity, from the tigers of Ranthambore to the elephants of Kerala. It's incredible!

unnormalised: But seriously, are we doing enough to protect it? I recently read an article about deforestation impacting elephant corridors in Chhattisgarh, forcing them into conflict with local villagers. Makes you wonder, doesn’t it?
normalised: But seriously, are we doing enough to protect it? I recently read an article about deforestation impacting elephant corridors in Chhattisgarh, forcing them into conflict with local villagers. Makes you wonder, doesn't it?

unnormalised: What concrete steps can we, as individuals, take to contribute to wildlife conservation? Beyond just donating to NGOs (which is definitely helpful!), what about supporting sustainable tourism initiatives in places like Jim Corbett National Park? This can help boost the local economy while also promoting responsible wildlife viewing.

unnormalised: I think education is also key. Maybe incorporating more wildlife conservation topics into school curriculums – imagine kids learning about the importance of Project Tiger at age 10! Remember the movie "Kaal"? Even though it was a bit… dramatic… it did raise awareness about the plight of tigers.
